utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'm just bringing in my old daughter who's really been complaining about having a runny nose and has been sneezing a lot over this past over this past week. I think the symptoms maybe started three or four days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what symptoms started first?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think the runny nose is what, what started first. And like kind of the nasal congestion. She was telling you that she felt that there was like pressure or congestion in her nose.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then this, when did this sneezing start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Surely after that probably maybe the same day or or the next day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, does she have any coughing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so she she did start to cough actually after that so that the cough has been there for the last, for the last maybe two to three days. It's a dry cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, for the last two to three days. OK, is she at all, coughing up any green or yellow material or any blood at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So, and are her symptoms constant? Or do they come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: They've been pretty constant, and they've gotten a little bit worse since they started. Three or four days ago, I I think now yeah, her symptoms are at her, at the worst right now. Just not feeling very well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been in contact with anyone at home or at school? If she's going to school versus at home for the pandemic right now, but any ill contacts at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Well, she has been going to school. There hasn't been any Covid cases where she goes and they've been cautious, but she is going to school right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any, anything that you've tried that has helped her like any over the counter cold medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any other symptoms like fevers, chills, shortness of breath, um, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, she did feel a bit warm to touch and has looked a bit flushed in her face. Just doesn't look like herself.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Does she behave like herself Like is she more tired at all? More irritable, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, she's been a, maybe a bit more, maybe a bit more tired and and a bit more irritable, but not not too bad. She, she missed school today but went yesterday.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any recent travel at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, we've been at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any headaches, nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any chest pain that she's described?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any changes in her bowel movement, constipation, diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that's been normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any urinary problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, she had a urinary tract infection when she was like little but hasn't had any since.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any issues with their sleep or appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: She has been a bit a bit fussy, but she's been sleeping OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, has she lost any weight recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no no. She's been gaining weight well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any exposure to any allergens or like fumes, dust animals?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I can't think of anything like that. We don't have any pets at Home and she's she's been hasn't been going anywhere else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, has she been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, she just said, ah, just yeah had a urinary tract infection when she was younger and that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any allergies to medications that you know of?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not that I'm aware of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Is she on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any hospitalizations or surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any family history of any lung or heart conditions or anything else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I I have high cholesterol but, and ah, and I'm taking a, a medication for it, but no, nothing else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, does, has she lost a sense of taste or smell at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, she hasn't said any anything like that, just the nasal congestion.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Did you feel any pressure in around her face at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, well yeah, I think so. She doesn't say, well, no pain but does feel like a bit of pressure with the congestion, I think.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm any issues developmentally as she was growing up like to meet are all our milestones at an appropriate age?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: She did yeah, she has met she was walking at the appropriate times and able to talk and does work really well in school and is social with with her classmates and peers.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So no, no issues or no complaints at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, there hasn't been any concerns. I feel that she's been developing normally.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. In our immunizations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: They are, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and were there any complications at all during your pregnancy with her or after the pregnancy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it was a vaginal delivery at 38 weeks and she was a normal weight. We were able to go home right away with with no complications. So yeah, things were good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and currently who does she live with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So myself and my, and my husband.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and does anyone smoke in the house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, my husband does smoke, but uh, I mean he smokes outside usually and and he smokes, I don't know, maybe a half a pack a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And I think that's all all the questions I have. Do you have any questions or concerns?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing else right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So yeah, based on her symptoms, she does seem to have some just a cold like symptoms, viral symptoms. And it's been, it's been you said three or four days in total, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, and so most likely it's just caused by a viral infection like common cold perhaps, it she doesn't have any worrying signs of any systemic things going on right now, so and no signs of like a bacterial infection that I would be concerned about that I would give antibiotics for right now. But definitely if her symptoms get worse at home and if she starts having any kind of shortness of breath, increased coughing with producing, more yellow or green material and if she gets more feverish, so will also do a physical exam and take her temperature today as well. But yeah, some of these things you just look out for, but yeah, so that that we'll do the physical examination and go from there.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Alright, thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
